Class Pile

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pile

  • public class Pile
extends java.lang.Object
    The Pile Class is used to create and maintain a pile of marbles for a game of Nim. It has an two integer variables, one holds the initial size of the pile and the other holds the current size of the pile. It has methods to return the current size and to remove marbles from the pile.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pile()
      Pile() method overrides the default constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getSize()
      getSize() method is an accessor method that returns currentSize as an integer.
      void removeMarbles(int qty)
      removeMarbles() is a mutator method that is used to remove marbles from the pile by decreasing the currentSize variable.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pile

        public Pile()
        Pile() method overrides the default constructor. It creates a random seed generator that is used to initiate the size variable with a random integer between 10 and 100. The currentSize variable then recieves a copy of the integer in size and all operations are made the the currentSize variable.

    • Method Detail

      • removeMarbles

        public void removeMarbles(int qty)
        removeMarbles() is a mutator method that is used to remove marbles from the pile by decreasing the currentSize variable.
        Parameters:
        qty - is an integer variable used to decrease currentSize by that amount.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        getSize() method is an accessor method that returns currentSize as an integer.
        Returns:
        an integer that corresponds to the current size of the pile of marbles.
